content.description: lot of options and decent holds

Super short, easy but fun problem on the backside of the biggest boulder at the Halfway Cluster (same as 'NE Traverse', and 'En Pointe'). Start with hands on two crimpy ledges, left foot pressed into the low crescent to the left, and work your way up with a few crossover moves. 3-4 moves.
content.location: West face of the biggest boulder at the Halfway Cluster (same as 'NE Traverse', and 'En Pointe').

content.description: Traverse along the NE face up the diagonal crack to large jug using an awkward side-pull, continue across left before topping out all the way left bluff/shore-side.*For length/fun, I've started around the corner (seaside), using a large crack to work feet up halfway to a ledge before working around the arete and lowering on a nice fat crimp into the crack. Projecting sit start variation below the start of the crack.
content.protection: Crash pad for exposed rock in landing above crux side pull.
content.location: Largest bloc at The Halfway Cluster. Diagonal crack running along NE face.

content.description: Bit painful, but short and sweet, techy, slab problem.Start with feet matched on large ledge on the 'soft' arête, left hand on nice incut side pull, right...well, where you can find it. Work your way up and right to top out on the corner of the face.
content.location: NW arête, moving up towards the bluff, on the largest block.

content.description: 4-5 smallish boulders about ~.4 miles west of The Golden Boulder. While the majority of these have short and sweet VB-V1 lines, there is a notable crack on the NE face of the largest boulder that makes for long, fun V2ish traverse with top out.
